_header: With this beetle been they beaten
_description: Warning of the punishment for voluntarily choosing poverty or mendicancy, at the end of cap. IV in Dives and Pauper — two couplets

BodAsh750.Note:
Variant form of Dives and Pauper, consisting of extracts; may not
                    include this portion.

BLRoy17Cxx.Transcription:
with þis betil be þei betynþat her childryn her good
                    schal letyn& ȝeuyn awey al her þing& gone hem self
                    on beggyng

BLRoy17Cxxi.Transcription:
Wyt þis betyl be þey betynþat her chyldren her gode
                    schal letynAnd ȝeuyn a wey al her þyngAnd gone hem self on
                    beggyng

GULHun270.Transcription:
With þis betyl ben þey betynÞat to her childryn her
                    good schul letyn& ȝeuen awey al her þing& gon hym
                    self a beggyng
GULHun270.Editions:
Barnum,  Priscilla Heath,
                        ed.  
             Dives and Pauper.
EETS
         2 vols. o.s. 275 (1976) and o.s. 280 (1980): 1.313.
